meanings.definition: To use or apply incorrectly or inappropriately.
meanings.sent1: She tends to misapply makeup, ending up with colorful cheeks.
meanings.sent2: Please do not misapply the rules during the game.
meanings.sent3: He misapplied the glue, causing his fingers to stick together.
meanings.sent4: The student misapplied the formula, leading to unexpected results.
meanings.sent5: Misapplying the instructions can result in a messy outcome.

meanings.definition: To use or apply wrongly or improperly.
meanings.sent1: The chef accidentally misapplied salt instead of sugar in the recipe.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to misapply the law in this case.
meanings.sent3: She misapplied the bandage, wrapping it around the wrong arm.
meanings.sent4: Misapplying trust can lead to broken relationships.
meanings.sent5: He learned the hard way that misapplying the brakes can be dangerous.
